Package com.pacman.ui

Class GamePanel

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
javax.swing.JComponent
javax.swing.JPanel
com.pacman.ui.jpanels.GamePanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class GamePanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.lang.Runnable
GamePanel class from Swing We use it as a container for graphics components during gameplay. Here is the Main Game Loop. Class methods are divided in 4 parts: - Constructor - Game Main Loop - Containing run method and 3 steps of Game Main Loop -> update, repaint, sleep - Aux Game - Auxiliary methods used by Game Main Loop methods - Aux Swing - Auxiliary methods used by Swing framework - Nested classes - In general EventListeners with easy access to this class members (that's why nested) - KeyboardHandler - ResizeHandler
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  GamePanel.GameState
    if isGameOver is false it means game is not over, we can still play if game is over we need to distinguish if player won or lose the game thats why this member is not boolean
    class  GamePanel.KeyboardHandler
    This class handles every keyboard input during the game.
    class  GamePanel.ResizeHandler
    This class handles window resizing during gameplay.

  • Field Details

    • screenSize

      java.awt.Dimension screenSize
      Size of a screen GameFrame uses pack() method so window size is same as this one. We use it also for computing resizing graphics components.

    • gameThread

      java.lang.Thread gameThread
      Thread of gameplay. GamePanel constructor creates new thread for gameplay. And the GameFrame thread, the parent of this one continues to live alongside.

    • player

      Player player
      Object representing pac-man

    • map

      Map map
      Object representing map.

    • clock

      Clock clock
      Measure time between frames. Used to keep constant speed of objects independently from FPS.

    • isPause

      boolean isPause
      Determines if the gameplay is paused

    • ghostManager

      GhostManager ghostManager
      GhostManager

    • collectableManager

      CollectableManager collectableManager
      CollectableManager

      Score

  • Constructor Details

    • GamePanel

      GamePanel()
      Default Constructor Sets JPanel and run the gameplay thread

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Run method from Runnable interface Contains the GAME MAIN LOOP
      Specified by:
      run in interface java.lang.Runnable

    • _update

      private void _update​(double dt)
      Update the game. Compute new positions for graphic components, check collisions etc... Every object should have it's _update() method to be called here.

    • paint

      public void paint​(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Paint the frame. This method is called by Swing update() method, which we call in repaint() in GAME MAIN LOOP. Here painting all objects takes place.
      Overrides:
      paint in class javax.swing.JComponent

    • sleep

      private void sleep()
      Sleep between frames. This is preventing our game from CPU abusing.

    • getPreferredSize

      public java.awt.Dimension getPreferredSize()
      Swing framework calls this method for GameFrame in pack(), this way GameFrame knows what size to take
      Overrides:
      getPreferredSize in class javax.swing.JComponent

    • pause

      public void pause()
      Set game into pause mode or resume the game
